strong.a: Notice of Cancellation Turlock Unified School District May 5, 2020 Board of Trustees Meeting

a.title: Alternative Formats

br.br: Per California Education Code Sec. 35164, The governing board shall act by majority vote of all of the membership constituting the governing board, the May 5, 2020 TUSD Board of Trustees Meeting will be cancelled due to lack of a quorum, with all potential agenda items moved forward to the May 19, 2020 TUSD Regular Board of Trustees Meeting.

a.title: Go to comments for Board Meeting Cancellation

span.p: All TUSD schools will remain closed through May 29, 2020. Visit our COVID-19 page for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for TUSD School Closures

div.p: Information on TUSD Secondary Summer School now available.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning

img.alt: Virtual Student and Staff Recognition Event

a.span: Virtual Student and Staff Recognition Event

div.p: Congratulations to our 2020 student and staff award recipients.

a.title: Go to comments for Virtual Student and Staff Recognition Event

div.p: Stay up to date on the most recent information from TUSD related to school closures due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

a.title: Go to comments for Stay Informed

div.p: Staring April 20, TUSD will distribute meals Monday-Thursday from 10 AM-12 PM at Dutcher, Pitman, and Wakefield.

a.title: Go to comments for Grab & Go Meals

div.p: Latest information on optional learning opportunities during school closures from the TUSD Ed Services team.

a.title: Go to comments for TUSD Learning

div.p: Join Coordinator Marshall Beyer and Ed Tech Coach Sitara Ali for virtual technology PD for teachers.

a.title: Go to comments for EdTech in TUSD

div.p: In an effort to stop the spread of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) and support social distancing, all TUSD playgrounds and fields will be closed to the public until further notice.

a.title: Go to comments for Stop the Spread

div.p: Phase 1 of Student Data Confirmation has started. Log into TUSD Family Link and confirm your student(s) information today.

a.title: Go to comments for We Need Your Info

div.p: Take a FREE 1 hour course from our No Bully partners to help ensure your child is neither a target of bullying nor a bully to other students.

a.title: Go to comments for Partner with TUSD

div.p: Completion of the 2020 Census is critical for millions of dollars in school funding. Census 2020 begins in March 2020.

a.title: Go to comments for Census 2020

div.p: Enrollment information now available for TK/K for the 2020-2021 school year.

a.title: Go to comments for Transitional Kindergarten/Kindergarten

div.p: We are ready to launch our TUSD 1:1 initiative for grades 7-12! Find out info on devices, insurance, digital citizenship, resources, and more!

a.title: Go to comments for TUSD 1:1 Parent Info

div.p: Thank you to our Turlock community for passing Measures N & O. So many projects already underway!

a.title: Go to comments for Stay Informed

img.alt: Visit the Child Nutrition Education Center Website

a.span: Visit the Child Nutrition Education Center Website

div.p: Find information on how to add funds to meal account, apply for free/reduced meal benefits., and coming soon find nutrition information for TUSD menus.

a.title: Go to comments for Visit the Child Nutrition Education Center Website

a.span: Check Out the TUSD Weekly Update

div.p: We hope you enjoy reading our weekly internal staff newsletter. Now you can "be in the know" too!

a.title: Go to comments for Check Out the TUSD Weekly Update

img.title: TUSD Vintage Classroom
img.span: The Turlock Unified School District is located in the heart of the Central Valley in Turlock, CA, and was established over a hundred years ago in 1906. With 14,000+ students in TUSD and nearly 1,500 staff, our strength is in our diverse, neighborhood schools. Each school engages our learners in a variety of unique and innovative ways including Two-Way Immersion Academies, Career Technical Education, NJROTC, Advanced Placement, GATE, music, STEM/STEAM, and much more. We look forward to sharing our unique TUSD story with you and encourage you to explore our website and follow us on social media. Thank you for visiting!
